column3: Response
column38: Are trying or should try to become legal
column42: Unfair/disrespectful to legal immigrants and citizens

column3: A criminal and a freeloader.
A driven person searching for a better life.
A family man, who is either trying to make money to send back with the family or is with the family to escape violence at home and to make a better life for themselves.
A generally lower socioeconomic classed person who works long hours to support their family
A hard working human that wants a better life.
A majority of illegal immigrants come in the form of families including Women and children. But also, a lot of illegal immigrants come searching for jobs.
A man who has come looking for work that will in turn allow him to bring or create a family
A person that crossed the border who is just trying to provide for their family, working harder than the average American.
a person trying to live a better life in our country
A person who has been forced to flee their home country and has found refuge in the US, although the government has not provided appropriate resources or space for them
A person who just wants a better life and moves to a new country to pursue that.

A person who stays past their visa's expiration date, most likely. I was skeptical to characterize broadly illegal immigrants in any capacity. Perhaps I should have marked higher in the "unlawful" category since they are breaking a civil statue by definition of being "illegal".

A typical illegal immigrant is somebody who clearly has a strong desire to be in this country and therefore I believe is willing to work quite hard to be here. On average I think most illegal immigrants come here with a high school degree or less because its so hard to immigrate here legally with those credentials. Finally I don't think illegal immigrants fall into any those negative categories like being immoral, unlawful, or violent more than the average American.

A typical immigrant is hard working and is resilient. They want the best for themselves and their family. They would do anything to ensure the safety and well being of the people they love. Often they dont have a choice but to make it to the US or wherever their destination may be. And although it's a huge risk, its often one many of them are willing to take.

A typical undocumented immigrant come to the Unitd States for a better life and for the money so they can provide food and shelter for their family. Therefore, the are hardworking and work all day all night trying to earn money even though they get paid a little bit.
All I have to say is, if there was a more reasonable way for them to become US citizens, they wouldn't be undocumented and have this negative stigma attached to them.

All illegal immigrants have committed a crime against the United States. While many are hardworking and good people that could strengthen this country, the mere fact that they are undocumented makes it impossible to legally pay taxes or have any kind of license.

Although I havent had much experience with illegal immigrants nor do I know a lot about this topic, but the few individuals I do know, work extremely hard and do their part to support themselves and their family financially and end up doing jobs many Americans do not want to do. They also work extremely hard to get their visas and try their hardest to become legal, but that sometimes get extremely costly and nerve-racking.
Although they can be hardworking and have morals, they still came into our country illegally.
amazing people that the system has failed by not providing a path to citizenship
Amazing people! Literally just wanting a place to live. Fr tho white poeple fromt he mayflower and like 1600's have done worse and they illegal
an impoverished person looking for a better life path
An individual that resides in a country illegally
An undocument immigrant is usually an economic refugee or political refugee who can't live or come back to their home country because there is no work or some violence is happening

An undocumented immigrant is someone that came to the United States illegally either through border crossing or overstaying a legal visa. They usually do so because they see the United States as better than their home country.

An undocumented immigrant is very hardworking and tries their best to be loyal to the new country that they're in. People tend to misconstrue them as bad people and criminals because the media frames them in a negative way. In reality, undocumented immigrants are not always criminals and actually make up most of the lard labor source in our country.
Anyone who comes into a country illegally.
Coming from a family of illegal immigrants, I have a favorable view of them and know they work very hard just to have better opportunities.

Considering documented immigrants and citizens hold the same descriptions for undocumented immigrants, this is sort of biased. We are all humans and we are all capable of violence and being educated at the same time. Has nothing to do with being documented or undocumented. Though undocumented immigrants bring their children here to achieve the best education they can get.

Despite what the media wants us to believe, the typical illegal immigrant isn't a criminal that tries to avoid paying taxes for the country. In fact, the typical immigrant is just trying to stay under the radar and is usually trying to provide for their families.

Economic or political refugees; people seeking work, greater opportunity, and a better life. Often escaping repression or violence. Many attempting to better support families back home and as a result are often very hardworking and driven.
either someone from Mexico or Canada who crossed the border illegally or someone who stayed past the expiration of their visa without renewal

Even though they have devoted themselves to the construction, development or other basic functions of the U.S. society, they are illegal. If they can violates the law to enter the US, they may also immoral in some ways.

First of all, it is much more respectful to refer to immigrants without documentation as undocumented immigrants rather than illegal immigrants. While the previous questions required the assumption of a large group of people as a whole, when thinking about immigrants,I think of them as normal citizens, and I believe that most citizens in the United States are good, hardworking people.

First off, for a political science experiment, you would think that the host of this survey would be politically correct in referring to UNDOCUMENTED immigrants. With that, I view all undocumented immigrants as humans, humans who felt that there are no opportunities in their home countries and have decided to search for work in US. Undocumented immigrants understand that they are not respected in this country, yet, set all of that aside so that they can work for the rest of their lives but know that this is for their family. Undocumented immigrants are hard working and the majority of them, come to the US to search for a better life, which is what the US is suppose to be, right?

First, I would not define them as illegal but rather undocumented. Second, I view them simply as individuals seeking better lives for themselves and their families. They are brave, hardworking and honest.

Firstly, I think that no one is illegal on stolen land. People may be undocumented citizens, but I do not believe they are "illegal." I think they are harworking and honest people who are just trying to make a better lives for themselves and/or their families. I think we should legalize all undocumented immigrants and make the immigration process easier.

For me it's hard to say and I think it comes down to a case by case basis. I think there is a good number of bad immigrants who add nothing to society, are sometimes criminals, and overall bring nothing to society. However, I I know that most of these people are just trying to start fresh and have a better life than the one they came from. But my problem is that if you're innocent why not just come into the country the legal way.

From my experience, most undocumented immigrants are from Mexico. Most of these people came to America to seek a better life for themselves and their families. My mother is an immigrant from the Philippines who was hoping for the same thing. She entered legally and is now a naturalized citizen, but I know the process to immigrate into the United States is extremely tough and is simply not an option for everyone. My aunt applied for a green card and it was not granted for 12 years, by which point she had almost forgotten that she had applied. I think immigrants are just people who want the best for their families, and that makes them no different than any natural-born citizen. Even if they entered illegally, they are no different because no human being is illegal.

From my point of view undocumented immigrants are people looking for a second chance or looking for a place where they can be able to find refuge. Part of the reason being that the people are ones that like anyone else want to improve their lives and more they want to help their families.
Hard workers who take jobs that no white American ever would
hard working and with a dream
Hard working people who came here for a better future
hard working seeking for a better life
Hard working, typically from an impoverished area and is desperate for a better situation
Hard working, willing to sacrifice for family and survival- heroes
hardworking
Hardworking and attempting to create a better life for themselves
Hardworking in pursuit of a better life
Hardworking people but have broken the law
hardworking people that are simply trying to provide them and their families with better lives, they are trying to work towards a stable opportunity
Hardworking people who should be incorporated into society. However, as difficult as it sounds, I do believe they should be deported if a violent crime or even perhaps a felony is committed.
Hardworking, believes in American dream, wants to create a "better live" for themselves and family

hardworking, timely, efficient, cooks, lawn management. while the majority of illegal immigrants are hardworking and working towards a visa or citizenship, the vast majority of people generalize all illegal immigrants by the few that commit crimes
Hardworking, trying their best

Has absolutely no respect for the rule of law and other immigrants who are seeking to apply to the United States under lawful processes such as immigrants coming from Asia who have been in the lottery process for over years and maybe decades. So it is not fair for those who also hopes for a better life at the United states and would love to obtain the opportunity to pursue their dreams and achieve the american dream they have heard about
Have a place in this country, even if others disagree with their residence here
Hispanic or Latino, usually coming to the United States to seek a better life for their family

I am a rule follower and would prefer if everyone just followed the law. However, I completely understand why people immigrate to the United States. I can only imagine how terrible it would be in your own country that you feel the need to come to a foreign country, perhaps not even knowing the language, leaving your family just so you can live a better life. That is hard and if someone feels that is their only option, who am I to judge them for coming over. I think the government should either fix the problem at the origin or find a faster easier way to get a visa/green card, etc.

I am aware of the stereotypes on illegal immigrants. Some people say they are uneducated, immoral, "stupid", and typically commit crimes. However, I think that is such a wrong way to think about them. Even though what they are doing is illegal, they should not be treated the way they are in the United States. Some of them are hard working and want what is best of their family. But Americans do wrong things as well.

I believe everyone should have the ability to obtain US citizenship in as easier manner than is currently possible. I do not view illegal immigrants negatively; they are just trying to find a path for themselves.

I believe illegal immigrants should attempt to legalize themselves in our country, but I also think these individuals deserve to have a good life and success in the United States. I believe the U.S. should make it easier for immigrants to become citizens, as I believe many of these individuals are hard working and intelligent and can make the country better.

I believe that a typical undocumented immigrant comes to the U.S. for better opportunities for themself and his/her family. Most of the time, they stay undocumented, and they find a place to work to provide for their family. They stay under the radar so they don't get deported.

I believe that illegal immigrants are hard-working individuals who care for their families. I believe that they have the same right to be here as anyone else who is in the country. I respect their drive and the sacrifices that they make for the hope of a better future.
I believe that majority of undocumented immigrants are hardworking people who don't have the right resources to get a green card and or citizenship.

I believe that many illegal immigrants come to the United States out of desperation and intend no harm to the American public or its institutions and rather are just trying to provide for themselves as they are leaving conditions in which this wasn't possible

I believe that most illegal immigrants come to this country in order to search for better work and a better life for their family, but some come here with intentions of violence or other unlawful activity

I believe that nobody should come into the United States illegally however there should be equip quicker process to those who are willing to work to become successful. We are a nation of the free but there are some requirements to get in.

I believe that they are hardworking individuals trying to make a name for themselves in our country. I think they deserve the right to an opportunity to earn money here just as much as anyone else in America.
I believe that undocumented immigrants are just trying to make it in the United States as much as anyone else.

I believe that undocumented immigrants are painted in a drastically bad way. I would say that the vast majority of them are here to find work and live a better life. Overall, illegal immigrants commit far less crime than those born here in the U.S.

I believe that undocumented immigrants come to America for a better life. America has always been the safe haven for immigrants to experience the "American Dream", but somehow immigrants have become a negative concept. I also understand that it is a difficult process to become a U.S. citizen, so I don't hold anything against undocumented immigrants like many people do in this country. A majority of undocumented immigrants work and do not mean harm, they just want to escape some horrible things and hope that the U.S. can help them.
I believe the page before is misleading. I voted neutral on all the cases because an illegal immigrant can be all of those things but it has nothing to do with them being an immigrant.
I believe the typical immigrant is extremely hardworking and caring. They take advantage of the opportunities offered and they provide a better life for their families.

I believe there is nothing wrong with immigrants. Immigrants become immigrants because they did not feel happy or safe in the place they once were. They leave to have better opportunities not only for themselves, but for their families as well, and everyone should be able to have opportunities for the better in their life.
I believe they are making a courageous choice and sacrifice, usually for their families.
I believe they tend to be working class, but harder-working than many citizens. I think many fears about them are because of nativist fearmongering.
I believe undocumented immigrants are typically very hardworking and respectable people who are just looking for a better life in America
I believe when I think of an illegal immigrant, I think of someone who moved to the US due to issues in their home country and looking for stable work.
I bieleve the typical illegal immigrant is handworking, stressed, sometimes uneducated but seeking success
I can't really say much as I am not in their place

I do not believe undocumented immigrants should be in this country competing for jobs, healthcare and social services. However, I also sympathize with the plights that drove them here and the search for a better life while having to deal with a very restrictive immigration system. You could say I have mixed feelings on this matter.

I do not harbor any negative feelings towards undocumented immigrants, rather I wish they would be able to go through the process of documentation easier and without the pain and struggle that could be the reason they've avoided it. I think that there is no "typical" undocumented immigrant, and while I'm sure there are rotten eggs, most people are good and should be treated with respect and kindness.

I do not have a view of “typical” undocumented immigrants. I’ve personally known many of them, and just like within any other group, there are various different types of people among them. There are nice people and there are jerks. The only consistent trait I’ve noticed is that they tend to be hard workers who keep their head down and try not to stand out or draw unneeded attention.
I do not have any opinions on illegal immigrants honestly. If they are coming here to work hard and prove for their families in hope of one day being a legal citizen then who am I to judge.
I do not have views on them. They are normal humans like the rest of us. Each one is an individual.
I do not support illegal immigrants and believe in the immigration process. Moreover, I think people with specialities in their fields should be emitted to the US over others.
I do think it is unlawful, but it is not right to stereotype someone as lazy, evil, or violent, no matter what the instance is without actually knowing them.
I don't hate undocumented immigrants. I don't like that some choose to come in an illegal manner. I wish more immigrants us the proper channels to work here
I don't have a connection to immigration, but all of my friends who do are against illegal immigration, so I'll take their word for it that people should actually try to come here legally

I don't have a single problem with undocumented immigrants. The only reason they exist is because the U.S. has such a stupid immigration system that they didn't have the choice to come legally. Also, a look through at America's foreign policy actions throughout history show that we've created or helped create a lot of the conditions that push immigrants from their home country to ours.
I don't have atypical view because there are so many immigrants from so many places
I don't judge undocumented citizens as there is probably a reason they are undocumented.

I don't know much about the average illegal immigrant. I assume they are more hardworking than lazy because they did the work to get here, however I don't know anything about their honesty, trustworthiness or certainly any negative characteristics, just that they would prefer to take their chances here.
I don't really have positive feeling about the undocumented immigrant because I believe that it's illegal.

I don't really know what a "typical illegal immigrant" means. This really strikes me as a loaded question. There is no "typical" illegal immigrant. Some are white people from europe who are just business professionals, some come from Asia or South american countries of many different races. What a ridiculous question this is. I don't make any judgements of someone simply based off the fact that they are not a citizen and are here "illegally". I leave those judgements until i know them as a person. The only thing I will say is to assign them bad values is something I disagree with because I do not think people are inherently bad, and all people are hardworking in one way or another. The rest are middle because you cannot just make a judgement based on if someone is illegal. Who am I to know? My grandmother was illegal, but that does not mean she was automatically honest or lazy and no one should view her those ways simply because of no citizenship.
I don't think I could make such generalizations.
I don’t have a strong opinion on illegal immigrants- I think it should be easier to become a US citizen, so we don’t have such a difficult time with this issue
I don‚Äôt really have an opinion as long as they are good individual people
I dont have many opinions on this topic. I can see both sides and can see that these people want a better life but also understand that the actions are illegal.

I feel as though illegal immigrants are put into a situation where they have to leave their home because of violence and other social instabilities. Most of them are hardworking individuals who are trying to provide a good life for their children. Although they are breaking the law, there needs to be a system where becoming a citizen would be easier.
I feel as though there is space for them and welcome them, I do however wish they would do something to work towards citizenship.
I feel like immigrants are important and should be valued because they are the ones that make the US diverse.
I feel like it is impossible to try and describe the typical characteristics of undocumented people given that the term includes people with a diversity of characteristics and experiences.

I feel like it's a hard topic to have a thorough understanding of because there's so many different factors going into this specific issue. Personally, I believe illegal immigrants shouldn't be granted the rights of regular citizens or of immigrants that got here legally. But at the same time I think the immigration process should be easier for those who really need to come into our country to do so.
I feel like most illegal immigrants are really only looking for a better life for themselves and their families.

I feel like people who are characterized as "illegal" immigrants are hardworking honest people who are only coming into the US to find SAFER lives. Many of the Middle Eastern and Latino immigrant coming into the US are in danger in their home countries. No one wants to leave everything they know and everyone they love and uproot their lives to move to a new and hostile nation, unless they felt that their and their familes' lives were in danger.

I feel like the typical undocumented immigrant is a hard-working person who came here to find a better life for their family. They are probably working multiple jobs or very long hours to make money to support their family.
I feel like the typical undocumented immigrant is very hardworking. They are not bad, immoral people. They are just searching for a better life for themselves/their families.
I feel like they are people who are very desperate to get away from their home country even if it is illegal
I feel like they should come to this country legally.
I feel like undocumented immigrants are forced into their circumstances and I feel sorry for them
I feel most undocumented immigrants come to the United States for better opportunity. I also feel that we mostly hear about undocumented citizens that come from southern North American countries.

I feel that like that illegal immigrants are generally good decent people who happen to come from poverty-stricken and crime-ridden areas. I would prefer them to enter legally and feel a strong attachment to the USA, but I also understand that they may be desperate for better life prospects and that is their number one concern.
I feel that they should be able to come here with open arms and help with the process.
I feel that undocumented immigrants are very hardworking and are just looking for a new life. They come from violent countries and just want a better life for their families.
I feel that while they are breaking the law they should be helped though the documenting process instead of treated like criminals.

I find myself subconsciously feeding into stereotypes that describe "illegal immigrants" but in many positive ways. I often think of hardworking parents who want better lives for themselves and their children. I also think of many individuals who are qualified and well-respected in many ways but simply cannot get their green cards because the current system granting them makes it very difficult to do so.
I find undocumented immigrants to be hard working and loyal.

I hate the labels and stereotypes that are associated when people think of the word "immigrant." It really is unjust to judge a person based on their legal status and whether or not they're an immigrant shouldn't have to define who they are. When I think of an illegal immigrant, I think about someone who is hardworking and trying to achieve the American dream.

I have a lot of empathy toward undocumented immigrants. I view them as hard working, determined and strong individuals who are fleeing from violence and instability in their home countries. I think that they are very courageous and come to this country in the hopes of finding peace, and better opportunities for themselves and their families
i have no feelings towards immigrants

I have no hate towards undocumented immigrants. My parents both legally immigrated here from the Philippines in hopes for a better life for my sibling and me. I have empathy for undocumented immigrants because in a lot of cases, they only seek for a better future for their family. I believe that they do not steal jobs because most of the jobs undocumented immigrants can get are ones that no one strives for. I wish it was easier for people to become legal citizens in the U.S. because then there wouldn't be as much undocumented ones. I wish my family from the Philippines can come here, but the immigration process is so difficult.
I have no idea on them

I have no issues with undocumented immigrants. I feel that all people have the right to leave their country of origin for a better life elsewhere. This being said I also believe that a country has a right to deny those looking to come in if they are a threat to the society. There is a fine line and it must be walked very carefully.
I have no problem with illegal immigrants. I think they are brave and searching to better their lifestyle and potentially their family's too.
I have no view exact they should be given equal opportunities to live a good life in America without having to worry about being deported
I have no view on them, they are both good and bad, some are educated and other are not. I just care if they abuse the systems in place.
I have nothing to elaborate her.
I have sympathy for the plight of undocumented immigrants but the law is more important than emotions.

I just think they are like anyone else in our country. Some have had good education and some have not. Some are good people and some are not. It has nothing to do with their immigration status and more to do with their personality and character.

I look at illegal imiigrants with a broader view; no two are the same, maybe with similar circumstances, but thats all. To me a typical illegal immigrant is loyal, hardworking, and responsible. They take on jobs here where they work endlessly to try and provide a better life for their loved ones. They fled a bad situation to try and help their families, that is acting as responsible as one can in a situation from my point of view. For the family they couldn't bring with them they send money back or try different ways to help them, that's loyalty. Education depends on the person, I believe that it doesn't matter if they are educated or not because we can aid those who are uneducated and help with schooling; create programs or such.
I maintain a negative attitude towards illegal immigration as a whole. But if they come to my country, don’t make troubles and live a good life, I don’t have any particular opinions.
I personally view undocumented individuals in a very high esteem. They are some of the most honest, hardworking, and down to earth people I have met.

I put neutral for some questions, because such internal characteristics are hard to assume for an entire community. I feel as if most immigrants are hardworking since they come to the US to make a better live for themselves and their families.
I see "illegal" immigrants as people who want to come to a new country to find better opportunities for themselves and their family.
I see them as just a regular american citizen. most of us came here as illegal immigrants in history so it is hard for us to talk poorly on them.
I see typical illegal immigrants as people who have no choice but to run from the situation they previously found themselves in

I tend to have very liberal views with regards to undocumented immigrants. I believe that the US is a great place for people to start prosperous lives and that immigrants also see it this way, which is why many of them come here for work and asylum. I believe that undocumented immigrants, for the most part, are very hardworking individuals and work many undesirable jobs that most natural-born Americans would not necessarily want to do. I do think that the goal of every undocumented immigrant should be to one day become a citizen. Overall, I have a positive view of undocumented immigrants.
I think a typical undocumented immigrant worked very hard to get where they are. They are willing to learn what they need to to be a loyal citizen and they are good people.
I think everyone deserves a chance and I do not think I could describe a "typical immigrant"
I think illegal immigrants should be advised to give themselves up to get paperwork so they can live a legal life.
I think illegal immigrants tend to be very hardworking people but I do not think much of their abilities.

I think it is wrong for illegal immigrants to be demonized in the way that they currently are in this country. This country was built by immigrants and many of them are extremely hard working and just want a better life for themselves and their family. I don't think that a human can be "illegal". If they are not harming others, there should not be a problem with them trying to start over in a new country. I think that this country needs some serious immigration reform and a huge reality check on how racist it truly is. I think that many people feel threatened by immigrants because of implicit (sometimes very explicit) biases especially when it comes to immigrants from country that aren't predominantly white or christian.
I think many undocumented immigrants come from unfortunate circumstances and do not have the time or luxury of going through the formal process to become citizens.
I think most come for work and are good honest people.

I think of a person who has left their native country because of a non ideal situation and has come to a new country in order to either work or seek asylum. They are often trying to provide for their family.
I think people who travel to the USA illegally are trying to make a better life for themselves. They should be allowed in our country.

I think that a lot of them can be very hardworking and take jobs that no one else wants. There have been stories though of undocumented immigrants drinking and driving and killing people or robbing stories, and a lot of people point out that the should not happen since they should not be here. I think that with every group there are flaws, but they are more pointed out with undocumented people since they are not here legally.
I think that I have a relatively favorable view of the typical illegal immigrant.

I think that immigrants are just as any other person disregarding their status as an immigrant. They may not be able to get a higher education because of federal loans but their character is not defined by the fact that they are an immigrant.
I think that immigrants are some of the most hardworking people.

I think that people make assumptions on undocumented immigrants just as they would make assumptions on other stereotyped groups. I think that this is unfair and you cannot generalize a group of people this large.
I think that there needs to be a solution for the people who are here and people need to start coming legally.
I think that they are decent people looking for better lives, but they need to come into the country the right way. That is why I put unlawful as rather high.
I think that they are very hard working, loyal, and misunderstood.
I think that they came illegally only because they needed to, and that the US immigration policy is too strict. They are hardworking and want to provide for their families to live a better life.

I think that they come to this country escaping poverty, corruption, or other things. If someone is willing to risk their life to leave their country it has to be for a reason. I think they are hardworking because they come and do jobs no one else will do for the bare minimum. I have very high views of working immigrants.
I think that they don't have bad intentions but should not have come to the country illegally.

I think that they're hardworking and family-focused people who want to try for a better life. Very friendly, care about the country and the people they know, are grateful for the opportunities they have here.
I think that they're usually people who are looking to have a better life and can't as easily as others due to the struggle of being able to become a U.S citizen.

I think that undocumented immigrants are all unique. Some seek political refuge, and I understand that US citizenship is hard to get but illegal immigration could potentially harm them more than help them. The punishment they could face from their government could be bad. But also, perhaps they weren't safe in their own. I think there need to be better institutions in place for immigration, but Americans need to be more sympathetic and less dehumanizing. You don't know everyone's story. If they're coming here though, I wish they would contribute to the economy and make a life for themselves! It would be good for them and us, but I understand that it's hard to start a life in a new country
I think that when I think of a typical illegal immigrant, I picture them to be someone who has sought to make a better life for themself and is very hardworking and driven.
I think the typical illegal immigrant is hardworking and a a valuable part of this country.

I think the typical illegal immigrant is very hardworking, honest, and loyal because they are coming here to try and build a better life. They understand that it is going to take hard work and determination and still they are willing to risk everything to start again.

I think the typical immigrant is very hardworking, and I think thats they best word to generally describe all immigrants with. These people have to work hard in order to serve in a new country, since most people move to a new country when they don't have much. First generations are typically uneducated but that is also based on my personal knowledge and experiences, as are all my answers to this survey. Lastly, they seem to work hard for the people that they love.

I think the typical undocumented immigrant is someone that is looking for a better life for themselves and their families. They are looking to pursue the American Dream, but they are unable to accomplish this through legal means.

I think the typical undocumented immigrant truly just wants to build a better life for themselves and their families. The legal process for obtaining citizenship is hard and complicated, and takes a long time. The same goes to applying for asylum - these immigrants are hardworking and usually take the jobs that Americans don‚Äôt want to do, and they work hard at them. Also, it‚Äôs dope as hell to be able to move to a new country and learn a new language - I would be terrified and it‚Äôs impressive and admirable.

I think the words that can be associated with undocumented immigrants depends on the situation they were in that forced them to come here. There are a wide variety of different reasons other than stereotypes.
I think they are hardworking people that are willing to do anything to live a better life
I think they are typically very hard-working and trying to better their families situations. However, they are still breaking the law.
I think they're humans and it's unfair to treat them badly.
I think they're just trying to forge a better life for themselves and their families and I can't fault anyone for that.
I think undocumented immigrants are extremely hardworking and shape what America should be all about-giving people an opportunity to build their lives freely.

i think undocumented immigrants are here to have access to the resources and stability that the US offers and to put yourself and your family through the potential danger means we should welcome and try to help them
I think undocumented immigrants are lawful, honest, hardworking, etc.

I think undocumented immigrants come here for a reason. That reason is not necessarily nefarious. They are usually just looking for a better life. Judging any of the previous characteristics off just their immigration status is not fair. Like anyone else it is a perosn to person thing. You can't judge someone's character just by their immigration status. Except that they are probably hard working, as they are trying to do good for their family.

I think undocumented immigrants the vast majority of the time come from difficult situations in their home countries and are just trying to make a better life for their families. I think they are very hardworking and usually don't have many other options.
I think undocumented people come to America for a better life. So I am think we should welcome them all.

I think undocumented workers work a lot harder than common people, especially in the US. I believe that their lack of proficiency in English and guidance from people in the US prevent them from achieving as much as they can, but if given the resources, they work twice as hard as the average person to succeed.

I think we could loosen restrictions to allow more people come in legally cause immigration isn't that big of a deal, but some of the reasons people had to come illegally could be fair reasons as to why they were denied. They're certainly intelligent and hardworking if they managed to go through the difficult process of getting in illegally. In my opinion, the typical undocumented immigrant has come to the US in search of a better life, and is willing to work as hard as any native-born Americans to get it. Coming in without proper documentation does not automatically make someone a "criminal" anymore than jaywalking does. Undocumented immigrants generally commit fewer crimes than people born in the US (perhaps due to fear of unjust deportation for even the smallest crime), which is why it's inaccurate to say undocumented immigrants are criminals. However, at the individual level, I try to avoid generalizing-- I would say that your average undocumented immigrant is, in most ways, very similar to your typical documented immigrant or US-born person, and deserves to be judged on his or her merits, values, and contributions, not on immigration status or country of origin.
